alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead; Jefferson; Madison (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 6:05PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Madison, northwestern Beaverhead and southern Jefferson Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 603 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles east of Butte to 10 miles northeast of Lemhi Idaho. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dillon, Sheridan, Whitehall, Twin Bridges, Jackson, Silver Star, Grant, Melrose, Dewey, Bannack, Waterloo, Glen, Beaverhead Rock State Park, Cardwell, Polaris, Lewis And Clark Caverns State Park, Elk Park and Bannack State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 46 and 93 , and between mile markers 134 and 138. Interstate 90 between mile markers 232 and 266. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may also lead to localized flooding, as well as debris flow down steep terrain. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southwestern Montana.
